author: Staff Reporter
text:
With Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail system (VVPAT), a new facility to be launched during this Assembly election, voters here can be doubly sure about who they had voted.

After casting their vote, the voters would have an opportunity to see the symbol of parties they had voted. The symbol would be visible on the VVPAT, attached to electronic voting machines, for seven seconds, said Sub Collector and Returning Officer of Thoothukudi Assembly Constituency S. Gopala Sundara Raj. He said here on Friday that the first of its kind facility would be available in all the 247 polling booths in Thoothukudi Assembly constituency alone.

The Election Commission had announced that VVPAT facility would be established in 17 Assembly constituencies in the State and Thoothukudi was one among them. Zonal officers deputed for the constituency had been trained to operate the facility.

A team of engineers from Bharat Electronics Limited, Bengaluru, offered them training after conducting first-level checking in the VVPATs kept at Pudukottai union office amid tight security.
title: New poll facility for Thoothukudi
